ul.li: The whole barcode package shall be flexible and extensible. New implementations (barcode type or output format) should be easy to add.
The design shall be done in a way that different barcode types (1D vs. 2D) can be supported.
The barcodes implementations shall be configured using XML and in a way that the whole package can easily be integrated into a bigger work.

section.title: org.krysalis.barcode4j
section.p: This package holds the primary interfaces for generating barcodes.

ul.li: BarcodeGenerator: Main interface for generating barcodes.
BarcodeClassResolver: Resolves symbolic names to barcode implementation classes.
BarcodeLogicHandler: Receives barcode events (similar to SAX events for XML) generated by barcode logic implementations.

section.p: BarcodeUtil is an very useful helper class. Have a look!

section.title: org.krysalis.barcode4j.impl
section.p: This package is the home of the standard barcode implementations. Each implementation consist mostly of two classes, a logic implementation and a presentation implementation. The presentation part calls the logic part to generate something similar to SAX events but for barcodes (See BarcodeLogicHandler).

section.title: org.krysalis.barcode4j.output (and subpackages)
section.p: This is where the various output formats are implemented. To implement a new coordinate-based output format the main task is to create a new CanvasProvider implementation.

section.title: org.krysalis.barcode4j.tools
section.p: This package contains various helper classes used internally.

section.title: org.krysalis.barcode4j.cli
section.p: This package contains the command-line interface.

section.title: org.krysalis.barcode4j.servlet
section.p: This package contains the barcode servlet.

section.title: org.krysalis.barcode4j.xalan
section.p: This package contains the XSLT extension for Apache Xalan.

section.title: org.krysalis.barcode4j.saxon
section.p: This package contains the XSLT extension for the SAXON XSLT Processor by Michael Kay.

section.title: org.krysalis.barcode4j.playground
section.p: This package contains the playground GUI application. It's used to play around with barcodes. Have fun!
